file_content.text: I suppose a shuttle was too much to hope for.
I found something.
It's not enough to simply crash the shuttle. I want to see the bodies. No bodies, no bonus.
Saresh is no longer in charge of the Republic.
Former chancellor.
Into the temple!
I'm sure there's another way out.
You've got a pretty positive attitude about all this.
You're rather upbeat.
Being Empress of the Sith and an optimist aren't mutually exclusive.
Reports from Dromund Kaas claim the Outlander is dead.
No... Father's spirit is still rattling around in there. His little pet is alive.
The truth is irrelevant. The rumors have thrown the Alliance into disarray. Now is the perfect time to strike.
Odessen is too heavily defended. That doesn't change just because their precious Outlander is missing.
Odessen is not the target.
Someone I should be familiar with?
Who?
I should have known Saresh was behind this. I've heard rumors she was working with the GenoHaradan.
I'm not surprised.
I had my suspicions. Saresh may no longer be chancellor, but she maintains control over the Republic.
Looks like we have some exploring to do.
Then let's find it.
I'll blast my way out if it means escaping this bone pit.
I'll make one if I have to.
You and I both, Commander. Shall we get moving?
Lead the way, Commander.
Chancellor Saresh. That Republic snake.
True, but Intelligence believes she still holds significant power.
Saresh is the former chancellor of the Republic, but Intelligence believes she hasn't given up her power entirely.
